In many cases you will receive a CRS in form of a word document. In this case you will need to extract all relevant requirements out of the document and manage them as separate entities. So for now we will stop working on our created document and we will do future exercises on the document we are going to import.
  • Save the example E-Library specification document provided on Home
  • Go to Specification Space and select import document
  • We can keep Title and Name of the imported document as it is. As document type we choose Requirement Specification so we can use it´s defined document workflow. 
  • Define an import rule which recognizes all requirements based on keywords: must,should,could
  • Define an additional import rule which adds all bullet points as child requirements
  • Define an advanced rule which adds all tables to the requirement description
  • Test your configuration using Preview button
  • Save your configuration (But don´t import yet) as Elibrary Spec Import
